Package a4

Class Heap<E,​P>

  • java.lang.Object
    • a4.Heap<E,​P>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PriorityQueue<E,​P>
    public class Heap<E,​P>
extends java.lang.Object
implements PriorityQueue<E,​P>
    An instance is a max-heap of distinct values of type E with priorities of type P (Integer or Double). Since it is a max-heap, the value with the highest priority will be at the root of the heap.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Heap​(java.util.Comparator<P> c)
      Constructor: an empty heap with a comparator

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void add​(E e, P p)
      Adds the element e with priority p to this heap.
      void changePriority​(E e, P p)
      Change the original priority of e to p
      java.util.Comparator<? super P> comparator()
      Returns the comparator used to order the priorities of this heap
      boolean contain​(E e)  
      P getPriority​(E e)  
      int left​(int i)  
      int parent​(int i)  
      E peek()
      Returns the value of this heap with the highest priority Runs in O(1) constant time
      E poll()
      Removes and returns the highest priority in the heap Runs in O(log n) time
      int right​(int i)  
      int size()
      Returns the size of this heap.
